document_data.name: Morohanotsurugi
document_data.location: Originally [[Kara-Tur]]"Morohanotsurugi" translates to "two-edged sword" in Japanese. Furthermore, the item description mentions a daimyo, which is a title exclusive to the Kara-Turan countries of [[Wa]] and [[Kozakura]] (both of which are Japan analogues). Therefore, ''Morohanotsurugi'' likely originated in either Wa or Kozakura, but not enough information is given to ascertain which one specifically.
document_data.Powers: Although a powerful [[magic]]al weapon, ''Morohanotsurugi'' was cursed to inflict grievous damage to its wielder when swung.
document_data.History: After a perceived slight from one of his serfs, the Kara-Turan liege lord [[Yodama Akira]] ordered an entire village burned to the ground. Although this was well within his right as a lord, Yodama's [[daimyo]] was deeply shamed by his actions. As a result, the daimyo commissioned ''Morohanotsurugi'' and gave it to Yodama to teach him the lesson that harming others should never be without consequence.
